Assignment 1: Inline & Block Elements

display: block;

display: block

What does it do? The element is displayed as a block-level element. Default style for headers and paragraphs.

p

Fig A: An example of the default style on two block-level elements.

display: inline

display: inline


What does it do? This is the default style. The element is displayed as an inline-level element (like a span).

li
li

display: inline-block;

display: inline-block

What does it do? The element is placed as an inline element (on the same line as adjacent content), but it behaves as a block element.

p
p

Fig A: Two paragraphs with inline-block style added. Paragraphs are now placed next to one another on the same line.

h1
p
p

Fig B: A block-level element with two inline-block elements.

h1 { display: block; }
p { display: inline-block; }
p { display: inline-block; }
